newsitem.title: SINGAPORE: Singapore HSFO seen discussed around $120-$124/T.
newsitem.headline: Singapore HSFO seen discussed around $120-$124/T.

text.p: High sulphur fuel oil prices on Tuesday were expected to be discussed firmer than Monday at between $121-$124 for 180-centistoke cargoes loading in October, traders said.

Indications on Monday were between $119-$121 per tonne. Traders said strong overnight crude gains would have caused prices to edge higher. A local trader told Reuters he would place his offer for end October loading supplies at $124 per tonne.
Two cargoes from South Korean refiners were heard to be distressed. Traders said both cargoes were for loading in October, one from Singapore and the other from South Korea.
Most traders agree that supplies remained adequate to meet demand. Pockets of demand were uncovered from Vietnam, Thailand and China, traders said.
In the swaps market, November fuel oil contract was bid/asked at $118.50/$120, up $1 from Monday's quotes.
